state_summary: Famed roboticist Rodney Brooks warns that humanoid robots won't be able to learn dexterity, making them essentially useless. Multiple VCs and AI scientists agree, expecting wide adoption only after a few years or more than a decade.
evidence: Rodney Brooks calls out the billions of venture dollars being poured into humanoid robot companies like Figure
Fady Saad, general partner at Cybernetix Ventures, is skeptical about the actual use case and revenues generated by humanoids
Sanja Fidler, vice president of AI research at Nvidia, compares the current interest in humanoids to the excitement around self-driving cars
Seth Winterroth, partner at Eclipse, says it will be a while before humanoid robots reach their full capabilities
keywords: humanoid robots, investment bubble, dexterity, VCs, AI scientists
